segments.en: 79. Shines as an Expert in the Monastic Law (1st)
“Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities shines as an expert in the monastic law.
They know what is an offense.
They know what is not an offense.
They know what is a light offense.
They know what is a serious offense.

segments.pli: sīlavā hoti … pe … samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu,
segments.en: They’re ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters; seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.

segments.pli: catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
segments.en: They get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

segments.pli: āsavānaṃ khayā … pe … sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato vinayadharo sobhatī”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these seven qualities shines as an expert in the monastic law.”
